item.title: Auto-Shield Transparent Balance
item.description: The Auto-Shield feature automatically transfers your transparent balance to the shielded address when it is greater than a configurable amount. It runs when it detects a change in your balance and schedules a transaction immediately. Auto-Shield threshold. A value of 0 disables auto shielding By default, shield when you pay. It can be overridden in the “advanced options” section of the Send page Remarks If you set a low threshold, it may make a lot of transactions However, if the threshold is high, your transparent balance could remain unshielded for a long time Each transaction costs 0.

item.title: Coin Control
item.description: By default, every received note that has enough confirmations can be picked in an outgoing transaction. With Coin Control, you can exclude some notes from being selected. Tap to select/deselect notes. Notes that are selected will not be spent

item.title: Send Options
item.description: Show/Hide advanced options Encrypted Memo Enable/Disable rounding to 0.001 coin. If rounding is disabled, the app uses zats: 1/100,000,000 of a coin If checked, the transaction will use the balance in the transparent address too Split Notes: The maximum amount per output note. If this is less than the amount sent, the app will create several notes. The change is not subject to this cap WARNING If the option to use the transparent balance is checked, the transaction will include the whole transparent balance.

item.title: Server
item.description: Choose the server that the wallet connects to In Auto mode, YWallet will connect for the best server (highest block height available) Lightwalletd is the server deployment sponsored by the zcash organization Enter the URL of your own deployment. For example, https://lwd.example.com:9067

item.title: Budget
item.description: The budget page shows your largest spending/payments and a chart of your past account balance. The table shows the top 5 addresses where you spent the most. The length of each segment is proportional to its amount Address or Contact Name. Tap to copy the address to the clipboard Total amount sent to the address Tap and hold to show the exact balance at a given time The time range can be adjusted on the Settings page

item.title: Theme
item.description: Select the theme color and Brightness Unlike other settings, changes are applied immediately. Custom Theme Select “Custom” as the theme Click on the Edit button to open the Theme Editor Choose the Primary color for OK buttons, etc Choose the Primary Variant color Choose the Secondary color for Cancel buttons, etc Choose the Secondary Variant color Custom themes have both light and dark versions.

item.title: Auto-Shield
item.description: Auto shield your transparent balance when it is higher than this value. The app will create a separate transaction Include the transparent balance in the spendable transaction amount Remarks A value of 0 for option 1 means no automatic shielding You can also shield your balance manually at any time Option 2 is similar to ZecWallet approach of handling transparent balance

item.title: Wallet Profit and Loss
item.description: Wallet P/L (Profit and Loss) calculates and displays your wallet performance versus fiat currency. It considers incoming funds as purchases at market price and outgoing funds as sales. For example, if you receive 1 ZEC when 1 ZEC=140 USD and then spend 0.5 ZEC when 1 ZEC=150 USD, your wallet performance will be: 0.5 x (150 - 140) of realized profit 0.5 x (150 - 140) of unrealized profit If later 1 ZEC=180 USD,

item.title: MultiPay
Contact List
item.description: Contact Name Contact Address Tap to go to the Send page with this contact address Add a new contact Long press to edit the name Swipe left/right to delete Remarks On the Send page, you can enter a contact name instead of an address Wherever the app displays an address, it will display a contact name if there is a contact with that address. Contacts are shared between all accounts

item.title: Chart Range
item.description: Choose the chart time range. They all end at the current date. By default, charts span 1 year (365 days) and can be set to 1 month (30 days), 3 months (90 days), and 6 months (180 days).

item.title: Cold Storage
item.description: In a cold storage transaction, the mobile account does not have the secret key needed for spending. However, it is able to build an unsigned transaction and export it as a file. The account owner moves the file to another computer that holds the secret key (preferably offline and air-gapped for security). On the offline computer, he signs the transaction and generate a now valid transaction that he saves to another file.

item.title: Miscellaneous
item.description: When checked, the app retrieves your transaction details (address & memo). It needs to send the transaction ID to the server. Therefore, the server can know which transactions belong to you When checked, your account balance will be hidden on the account page if your device is tilted forward or is put down When checked, sending coins require pin or biometrics authentication When checked, opening the app require pin or biometrics authentication Remarks Running your personal deployment of lightwalletd is the best way to keep all of your information private Changing the setting “Protect Send” also require authentication

item.title: Sub-Account
item.description: Main Account Your main account is displayed in bold face. There is one main account for each coin. When you spend and receive coins from the dashboard shortcuts, the funds will be directed to the main account. The main account is the last account you selected for that particular coin. Sub Accounts A seed phrase can derive a multitude of accounts. By default, Ywallet uses only the first account. However, if you want to create additional accounts with the same seed, you can tell it to use additional account indexes.

item.title: Custom Derivation Path
item.description: For Transparent Addresses Only For a single account, it is easier to use the scan sub account feature. If you have funds in a legacy wallet (pre NU-5) that hasn’t been upgraded to support transaction V5, your funds are inaccessible. However, you can create an account in YWallet using the same seed phrase and derivation path. The resulting secret key and address will be identical and you will be able to sweep your funds.

item.title: Add/Edit/Delete
item.description: Tap to open the QR code scanner An address should be assigned to a single contact

item.title: Batch Save/Load
item.description: Save all your Accounts Save the encryption key! Save the backup file The backup cannot be restored without the encryption key. Note: Every backup gets its unique encryption key (even if the accounts are the same) Restore a full backup Enter or paste the encryption key Load the backup file

item.title: Message List
item.description: Messages are contained in the memo field. Whenever you send to a shielded address, you can attach some data through the memo. Memos have a maximum size of 512 bytes which is enough in most cases. Message List Avatar of the Sender or Recipient. The color depends on their initial Sender or Receiver and the direction (out/in) Date/Time Subject. Unread messages are shown in bold Content Tap to send a new message Message Table The Message Table is shown if you have selected it in the settings.

item.title: Overview
item.description: Y/ZWallet supports one or many accounts. Each account has a shielded and transparent address (unless it was restored from a secret key). An address has zero or more notes. For shielded accounts, notes are encrypted and only visible to the account owner. Transparent addresses have notes in cleartext. A note is conceptually an “I Owe You”. It can have any amount greater than zero (including zero). The account balance is the sum of all the note amounts.

item.title: Welcome to YWallet
item.description: When the application starts for the first time or when there aren’t any accounts, it will show the welcome page. Tap the “New Account” to start the creation of your first account. First Account Enter a name for the account. The name is only kept in your device. Choose the crypto Tap “New” Please make sure that you save the seed words when it reminds you. The seed words are the list of 24 words shown on the backup page.

item.title: Reset
item.description: After a major upgrade, the app may exhibit incorrect behavior. If this happens, the easiest way to fix the issue is to uninstall, reinstall and restore from seed. You should always have a safe copy of your seed phrase If your phone or computer crashes and you don’t have the seed phrase, your funds are LOST. But if you really don’t have the seed phrase and the app is still working you can try resetting it by following the instructions below.

item.title: UI Mode
item.description: By default, Ywallet runs in “Simple Mode” where only the basic UI elements are shown. Account Information Messages Transaction History Contacts To show the rest of the UI, switch to “Advanced Mode” in the application settings

item.title: Account Manager
item.description: Open the account manager by selecting “Accounts” in the app menu. Name Total Balance Shielded Balance Transparent Balance Long Press to Edit Name Swipe left/right to Delete Add/Restore Account To return to the account page, select an account by tapping on its name. Or press the back button, if you don’t want to change the current selection. Remarks The account that has its name in bold face is the default account for its currency.

item.title: Account summary
item.description: Shielded Mode Address QR Code Address (middle part elided) Copy address to clipboard Show address QR Code full screen without other data Account Balance (up to 1/1000 of a coin) Remaining part of the Account balance (below 1/1000 coin) Press to generate a new (diversified) address Press to go to the send page Balance in Fiat currency and Exchange Rate Notes Diversified (or snap addresses) show up for a few seconds.

item.title: Import from ZecWallet Lite
item.description: You can import your wallet keys from ZWL directly into YWallet without needing to synchronize ZWL. This can be useful when ZWL fails to open. ZecWallet Lite is not responsive until it is fully synced up. If your wallet cannot be synced, you will not be able to operate ZWL. For example, it may get appear stuck on the loading screen. However, zecwallet-lite-cli the command line version of ZWL has an option to by-pass synchronization.

item.title: Message Details
item.description: Navigation Go to the previous message in same thread (i.e. same subject) Go to the previous message Go to the next message Go to the next message in same thread (i.e. same subject) Reply If the message has a sender, click on this button to reply to it. It will open a send dialog box with the subject and recipient prepopulated.

item.title: Save to Blockchain
item.description: Changes to your contacts are first saved locally on your device. Tap this button if you want to store them in the blockchain. The app will make a transaction that saves your contact list. It costs 0.01 mY/ZEC Remarks Contacts that are saved in the blockchain are recovered when the account is restored from its seed

item.title: Adding More Accounts
item.description: Press the button + in the bottom right corner. It opens the account creation and restoration page. Choose the currency Give a name to your new account. But leave the field “Seed/Secret Key/Viewing Key” empty for a new account. Press the button “NEW…”. The app will show the account backup information. Your backup is the 24 words in the top box. You must keep these words in a safe place.

item.title: Synchronization
item.description: Synchronization (Catchup) will automatically start when YWallet detects that it does not have the latest block data. You can also manually trigger a rescan through the application menu. During Rescan or Catchup, the blockheight will cycle between the following information: current height / latest height synchronization % number of blocks remaining to process timestamp of latest block processed ETA (Estimated Time Remaining to complete the scan) Tapping on the display will alternate between cycling and a fixed display.

item.title: Backup Restore
item.description: Backup Backups are very important and must be taken unless you don’t mind losing access to the account and the coins it contains. Fortunately, it is very easy to make a backup. The account backup is the 24 words (in sequence) displayed on the Backup page (seed phrase) When you create a new account, the app will show you the Backup page automatically. If you need to recall that page, open the app menu and select “Backup”.

item.title: Key Tool
item.description: The Key Tool is a transparent & secret key derivation tool based on BIP32/39/44 and ZIP32. It is similar to the Mnemonic Code Converter but specifically for Zcash and Ycash. With the Key Tool, you can extract the private keys of most (all?) of the other wallets, as long as they use a seed phrase. Ledger, Coinomi, Edge, Nighthawk, ZecWallet Lite Zcash (HDSeed) However, the information varies from wallet to wallet.

item.title: Receive coins
item.description: The person who sends you coins needs to know your account address. There are several ways to communicate it. The wallet shows the address on the account page, but it is long and unpractical to type it in. It is more practical to do one of the following: Copy it to the clipboard and paste it into an email/chat Tilt your device forward and let them scan your QR Code (your balance is hidden)

item.title: Send a Message
item.description: Send Sending a message is done through the regular “Send YEC/ZEC” dialog box. Check if you want to include your address Subject Body You can also attach some coins with the message.

item.title: Notes
item.description: The Note Tab shows your received notes. Display and Sorting Tap to toggle the display of Height or Number of Confirmations Tap to sort by Date/Time (switches between ascending, descending, and unsorted) Tap to sort by Amount Larger notes appear in bolder typeface Status Notes spent in unconfirmed transactions are crossed out Notes that don’t have enough confirmations (3 by default) are dimmed Navigation Current Page Go to First Page Previous Page Next Page Go to Last Page Adjust the Number of rows per page.

item.title: Send coins
item.description: Start from the account page by clicking on the “Send” button in the bottom right corner Address to send coins to Tap to open the QR code scanner Either enter the amount in mZEC or Enter the amount in Fiat currency. The other field updates automatically Tap to spend the entire balance Show/Collapse advanced options Tap to send. Detailed balances Total balance available = transparent + shielded Shielded NOTES that don’t have enough confirmations for sending Shielded notes that were excluded from sending (COIN CONTROL) Transparent balance.

item.title: Settings
item.description: Settings The only new setting for Messages is the option to include your address by default. If enabled, the send dialog box will have this option pre-checked.

item.title: Internal Format
item.description: In order to support messages with subject and sender, YWallet formats the memo field in a particular way. Other wallets will see messages as this: ðŸ›¡MSG ys19xxuxdrw07fjz6j0u0cfcfeczg04pfupcm7pae0tyy4qn0wzmsp87nntfmlkxu2tcqz4xsy9exf hey Wanna get brunch on Sunday? The first line ðŸ›¡MSG indicates that it is a YWallet shielded message. The second line is the address of the sender. The later may choose to remain anonymous, in which case this line is empty. The third line is the subject of the message.

item.title: Payment URI
item.description: The Receive/Payment URI page is for making QR codes that encode your receiving address (shielded or transparent) an amount requested in coins or in fiat currency and a memo text Once you fill these fields, tap the “Make QR” button to update the QR code. If you don’t tap the button, the QR code is just your receiving address. You can also tap the QR code to refresh it.

item.title: Transactions
item.description: The History Tab shows the transaction history. Tap to toggle the display of height / confirmations Tap to sort by Date/Time (switches between ascending, descending, and unsorted) Tap to sort by Amount Tap to sort by Transaction ID Current page range Go to First Page Previous Page Next Page Go to Last Page Adjust the Number of rows per page. You may have to scroll the footer to the left if your screen is too small.

item.title: Synchronization
item.description: The app keeps up to date with the blockchain automatically. It checks the current status of the blockchain every 15s. Rescan You can manually trigger a rescan. Either from the first block, or from a given date (1). Scan Progress Status Current block height being processed Latest block height The Estimated remaining time of the full scan When the app is synchronized with the current block, it just displays the block height.
